intro: Carduus argutus, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a sturdy stem covered in stiff, bristly hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and prominent veins, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Carduus argutus is often found in dry meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
